title: 109_hr772
content: The Act titled "Resuming Education After Defense Service Act of 2005" allows educational assistance under the Montgomery GI Bill for members of the Selected Reserve who have served more than 2 years of active duty service during any 5-year period. The Act allows educational assistance for Selected Reserve members who serve on active duty in the Armed Forces between September 11, 2001, and December 31, 2006. The Act provides educational assistance for Selected Reserve members with at least two years of active duty service within a five-year period. The Act offers educational assistance for Selected Reserve members based on active duty service periods after specific dates. The Act provides educational assistance for Selected Reserve members based on active duty service periods. Amendments are made to the amount of assistance and contribution sections in the title. Amendments are made to the amount of assistance and contribution sections in the title regarding Selected Reserve members' educational assistance based on active duty service periods. The basic pay of individuals not making an election under subsection (d)(1) will be reduced by $100 for each of the first 12 months of active duty service. The Secretaries concerned are required to inform members of the Selected Reserve about their entitlements. Selected Reserve members entitled to educational assistance benefits under chapter 30 of title 38, United States Code, must be informed of the minimum service requirements and the nature of benefits. The terms "Secretary concerned" and "Selected Reserve" are defined in title 38, United States Code.
